intro: Harveya lactea, commonly known as the milkweed plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a defining feature of the genus Harveya. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has simple, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white and are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. Harveya lactea is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native wildlife.
